articles.title: Gallery
articles.description:
A selection of the plots I made for #TidyTuesday. Find the whole list
[here](https://github.com/etiennebacher/tidytuesday).

articles.title: Etienne Bacher

Etienne Bacher

              Etienne Bacher

            I am a French PhD student in the Doctoral Team Unit ACROSS at LISER, Luxembourg. I study the relationship between cross-border mobility, attitudes and political preferences.
            Besides working on this topic, I also enjoy programming with R by creating Shiny apps or packages that you can find on GitHub. I also write blog articles about R from time to time, that you can find in the “Blog” tab above.
            If you want to contact me, the best way to do so is by email.
            
            
            
             Interests 
            Economics
            International migration
            Political attitudes
            R programming
            
            
             Education 
            
            PhD student in Economics of Migration, 2020 - current 
            LISER, Luxembourg
            
            
            
            Master’s degree in Development Economics, 2018 - 2020 
            University Clermont-Auvergne, France
            
            
            
            Bachelor’s degree in Development Economics, 2017 - 2018 
            University Clermont-Auvergne, France

    Website created with the R package distill.

Software





altdoc


Use docute, docsify or mkdocs to create a website for your R package.

See more





prompter


This package allows to easily add tooltips to HTML elements in R Shiny applications. It uses hint.css under the hood.

See more





conductor


 Create tours in R Shiny applications using shepherd.js.

See more





R-JS adaptation


A list of all Javascript libraries adapted in R.

See more





shinyfullscreen


Use screenfull.js to put HTML elements in fullscreen in R Shiny applications.

See more





circletyper


Curve text elements in R Shiny applications, using Circletype.js.

See more

Research
Work in progress
Etienne Bacher, Michel Beine, Hillel Rapoport (2022), Do anti-immigration attitudes discourage migrants from coming?
Software
